mods.abstract: Run away, FROM the undersigned, in Grand Prairie, Parish of St. Landry, on the 7th of August last, a mulattowoman named PATIENCE, aged about 24 years, pretty face, and wearing a habitually gold ring on one of her left hand's finger. She is of middle size. It is supposed that she is lurking or harbored about Fausse Pointe, in the Parish of St. Martin. A liberal reward will be given to whomsoever will bring back said girl to the undersigned, or lodge her in one of the Jails of this State so that he can have her back. JOSEPH DESHOTELS. Parish of St. Landry, Oct. 13, 1855. 3t.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
